title: Loving this non-tribunal system we got going
body: So I just got permanently banned, for a single game, I didn't feed on purpose, I didn't afk, all I did was critique our mid and get slightly upset that he took smite into mid lane. If I got autobanned because I had swear words in my chat, that doesn't really make sense as I didn't use them as verbs I used them as Adjectives, I.E. How the **** did that land?, I expressed after I got caught by a taunt after the fact. The fact that I got autobanned for a single game is just utterly ridiculous, especially considering that no tribunal looked at it, and the ban went off literally minutes after the game. This punishment system is ludicrous and unfair as it doesn't take into account any other factors that were happening in the game, nor anything else that anyone said. It just looks at if enough people reported you, (typically just consists of most of the enemy team), and then searches for trigger words despite how they are used or what their intent was.

Conclusion: 

Whenever someone doesn't perform to your standards you resort to name calling, report calling and verbal harassment for the rest of the game. When they complain about you harassing them you just laugh it off like they're in the wrong even though you're the one who started harassing them in the first place.

Advice: 

* Don't call for reports ever. It solves nothing, makes it more likely that the other person will continue with their actions anyway and opens up valid reports against you as well.
* There's never an excuse to resort to verbal abuse, ever. If someone is performing poorly, kindly offer some friendly tips or advice as to how they can improve their gameplay. Being a jerk and then laughing about it when you're called out on it only makes you look like a selfish and uncaring jerk.
* Having a bad game does not equal feeding. We all have bad games every now and then, even you, but does that mean that we're feeding? No. As long as someone is actively trying to win the game then it's not feeding just because they're having a bad game.

My verdict:  Punish.

P.S. All permabans are reviewed by Riot directly, and they go through the entire account history before deciding if the account in question deserves a permaban or not. Also, you aren't banned for a single game unless it's extreme enough to warrant an escalation (i.e. verbal abuse, racist comments, etc.).

Reform Cards never show all games that you're reported in (there's no need), but you have to be valid reported in a ton of your games to warrant a case, and you have had to ignore 35 games worth of chat restrictions+a 2 week ban to get a permaban.

Its funny when people say they'll go grab the tinfoil hats, when what I'm saying has been proven to be true, maybe not by riot, but lets look at other games, Micro transaction games, which LoL is one. Have been proven to be more expensive than say subscription based models, and they garner most of their income from the few addicted players, indeed many players do not spend any money at all, but those few addicted players do. And when you are addicted to a game you are more invested and more likely to have emotions run rampant, and thus be "toxic" according to you. Now if you ban these toxic players, a disproportionate punishment for the offense, some will quit, but others, more will more likely than not buy in again, and spend large amounts of money. Its the reason games like Runescape and WoW don't typically ban members, because they are subscription based (largely) and so they don't receive this increased money from addicted players spending on micro transactions again.

* These guys spend a lot of money. What should we do?
* _Golly Tom, let's get rid of some of them for no reason._
* What if they come back and keep spending money Abe?

* What about the guys that stay and keep spending money?
* _Give them a couple of months Tom and then we ban some of that lot too._
* Well what about after that?
* _We keep thining the herd untill no one spends more money Tom._
* Good plan Abe.

I seriously doubt that riot reviewed it directly as I had received the ban, a mere 2 minutes after the game had ended, that they reported me for. And when you look at the chat it doesn't show the difference between all chat and team chat, nor does it show what other players are saying. For instance, Azir was equally harassing me, and he was indeed feeding in the game, not just "feeding", and retorting to me and saying I was playing badly. Our mordekaiser did actually afk, and I don't see how calling for reports can be considered harassment since, that happens in I don't know 98% of the games I play, whether my team is doing well or not, because people love to blame other players. According to you, every time I see someone say report so and so, I should actually report the player who is asking for the reporting to happen because clearly they are in the wrong. I do not see how saying 2/6 Azir talks a big game is harasment, as its merely making a comment about how he was harassing my play, whilst playing poorly himself. And after that I merely recounted a tale of someone who invited me to a 1v1 and was beaten badly, then afk'd in the first 5 minutes.

Can you show us your chat logs? If you log in to your account then you will be provided with an in client reform card that can show up to three games of chat logs which led up to your punishment. And you don't get banned for just literally one game unless you were unbeleivable toxic.

I'm also guessing you have had the previous punishments before correct? They are as follows:

* 10 game chat restriction
* 25 game chat restriction
* 14 day ban

The warnings/punishments I had received happened months ago... from which point my behavior had improved quite substantially as can be seen by me not immediately getting banned as soon as I got off the ban. But taking essentially a few days short of the three month downgrade.

The more I think about it, the more I'm starting to think Riot uses the same autoban system as games like Club Penguin, that when a report is received, it checks the chat logs to see if any trigger words or phrases were used, and if they're found regardless they give you punishment. It all makes sense now, why people who afk/feed/troll  never get banned, but "toxic" people do.

A sense of personality in a multiplayer game doesn't add to the game? Why not just play a single player game if all you want is your teammates to ping when they're coming, and nothing else. Regardless a permanent chat restriction is probably a way better fix than a permanent account ban. The banning of the account only serves to make you start over and invest more time/money into the game.
